snippet: During the 2011 civil war, Guillaume Soro, the parliament speaker, acquired 300 tons of weapons, many of which remain under the control of his loyalists in the army.
abstract: United Nations investigators reveal Ivory Coast parliament speaker Guillaume Soro, often mentioned as Pres Alassane Ouattara's successor, amassed hundreds of tons of weapons by taking advantage of 2011 civil war and its aftermath.
lead_paragraph: During the 2011 civil war, Guillaume Soro, the parliament speaker, acquired 300 tons of weapons, many of which remain under the control of his loyalists in the army.

headline.main: Ivory Coast: Politician Acquired Tons of Weapons, U.N. Investigation Finds
headline.print_headline: Africa; Ivory Coast: Politician Acquired Tons of Weapons, U.N. Investigation Finds
